intro: Platycaulos, commonly known as the flat-stemmed plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its distinctive flat or prostrate stems that often lie close to the ground. The leaves are typically narrow and arranged alternately along the stem. The flowers are small and clustered in composite flower heads, which are a defining feature of the Asteraceae family. Platycaulos species are often found in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with their succulent-like leaves and deep root systems.
